main_page_ai_sections.title: Introduction
Goals
main_page_ai_sections.content: Since 2022, [[large language models]] (LLMs) like [[Generative pre-trained transformer|GPT]]s have become a convenient tool for writing at scale. Unfortunately, these models virtually always fail to properly source claims and often introduce errors. Essays like [[WP:LLM]] strongly encourage care in using them for editing articles. These are the project's goals: * To identify text written by AI, and proofread such text to make sure they follow Wikipedia's policies. Any unsourced or likely inaccurate claims should be removed. * To identify AI-generated images and ensure appropriate usage. * To help and keep track of AI-using editors who may not realize the deficiencies of AI as a writing tool. The purpose of this project is not to restrict or ban the use of AI in articles, but to verify that its output is acceptable and constructive, and to fix or remove it otherwise.

main_page_ai_sections.title: Editing advice
main_page_ai_sections.content:
* Tag articles with appropriate templates, remove unsourced information and warn users who add unsourced AI-generated content to articles.
* Articles that are clearly entirely LLM-generated pages without human review can be nominated for [[WP:SPEEDY|speedy deletion]] under [[WP:G15]].
* Identifying AI-assisted edits is difficult in most cases since the generated text is often indistinguishable from human text. The [[WP:AISIGNS|signs of AI writing]] page provides a list of characteristics that are associated with text generated by AI chatbots.
** If the text contains phrases like "as an AI model" or "as of my last knowledge update", or if the editor copy-pasted the [[Prompt engineering|prompt]] used to generate the text together with the AI response, the text is almost certainly AI-generated.
** Other indications include the presence of fake references or other obvious [[Hallucination (artificial intelligence)|AI hallucinations]]. AI content sometimes takes a promotional tone, reading like a tourism website. Other times, the AI gets confused and will [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Villa_Llao_Llao&oldid=1188096973 write about] [[Llao Llao Hotel|a hotel]] instead of [[Villa Llao Llao|a nearby village]].
** [[AI content detection]] tools like [[GPTZero]] are unreliable and should not be used as the sole means of determining whether text is AI-generated. Given the high rate of false positives, deleting or tagging content purely because it was flagged by an automatic AI detector is not acceptable.
* When missing more precise information, AI will often describe in detail very generic and common features, praising [[Rezaabad, Saveh|a village]] for its [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Rezaabad,_Saveh&diff=prev&oldid=1187912265 fertile farmlands, livestock and scenic countryside] despite it being in an arid mountain range.
* AI content is not always "unsourced"‚Äîsometimes it has real sources that are unrelated to the article's topic, sometimes it creates its own [[Wikipedia:Fictitious references|fake sources]], and sometimes it uses legitimate sources to create the AI content. Be careful when removing bad AI content not to remove legitimate sources, and always check the cited sources for legitimacy.
** Example: the article [[Special:Permalink/1188376670|Leninist historiography]] was entirely written by AI and previously included a [https://web.archive.org/web/20230927000223/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leninist_historiography list of completely fake sources] in Russian and Hungarian at the bottom of the page. Google turned up no results for these sources.
** Other example: the article ''[[Estola albosignata]]'', about a beetle species, had [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Estola_albosignata&diff=prev&oldid=1152503574 paragraphs written by AI] sourced to actual German and French sources. While the sourced articles were real, they were completely off-topic, with the French one discussing a completely unrelated lifeform.
* Sometimes entire articles are AI-generated, and in such a case, make sure to check that the topic is legitimate and [[Wikipedia:Notability|notable]]. Occasionally, [[WP:HOAX]]es have made it onto Wikipedia because AI tools can create fake citations that may appear legitimate. 
** Example: the article [[Wikipedia:List of hoaxes on Wikipedia/Amberlihisar|Amberlihisar]] was created in January 2023, passed [[Wikipedia:articles for creation|articles for creation]], and was not discovered to be entirely fictional until December 2023. It has since now been deleted.
* Text that was present in an article before November 30, 2022 (the release date of [[ChatGPT]]) is very unlikely to be AI-generated.

main_page_ai_sections.title: Open tasks
main_page_ai_sections.content: See [[:Category:Articles containing suspected AI-generated texts]] for all articles that have been tagged as possibly {{tl|AI-generated}}. The [[Wikipedia:WikiProject AI Cleanup/Tasks|tasks page]] recommends ways to handle articles, talk page discussions, and sources that use AI-generated content.

main_page_ai_sections.title: Introduction
main_page_ai_sections.content:
{{short description|Subject-matter collaboration area}} {{bots|deny=Harej bot}} {{redirect|WP:JOURNAL|text=For the "''What Wikipedia is not''" policy, see [[WP:NOTJOURNAL]]}} {{Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals/Tabs}} {{Portal:Physics/box-header|WikiProject Academic Journals|Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals}} {{WikiProject status|active|sc1=WP:AJ|sc2=WP:JOURNALS}} {{topic|Academic journals|stubtype=Academic journal|category=Academic journals|delsort=Academic Journals|project=Academic Journals|collab=WikiProject Academic Journals/Collaboration}} {{ArticlesByQuality|topic=Academic Journal|project=Academic Journals}} Welcome to '''WikiProject Academic Journals''', a [[Wikipedia:WikiProject|collaboration area and group of editors]] dedicated to improving Wikipedia's coverage of [[academic journal]]s, [[proceedings|conference proceedings]], [[monographic series]], and other scholarly [[serial (publishing)|serial publications]]. Specifically, this means expanding, categorizing, and cleaning up existing articles, as well as creating new ones. If you plan to be active in editing articles relating to academic journals, please add your name and your interests to the [[#Participants|Participant list]] below. Concrete proposals and suggestions to improve the WikiProject and articles are discussed on the [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Academic Journals|talk page]], and any and all interested parties are encouraged to join up and participate. {{Box-footer|}}
{{Portal:Physics/box-header|Scope & Goals|Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals}} {{TOC left}} The project was originally started to cover [[academic journal]]s, but the scope has naturally expanded to cover related areas not covered by other WikiProjects. We want to improve the quality of articles about academic journals and their related topics, encourage the use of {{tl|cite journal}} and other {{tl|cite}} templates, and create articles from the [[Wikipedia:List of missing journals|list of missing journals]] and [[Wikipedia:WikiProject_Academic_Journals/Journals_cited_by_Wikipedia/Missing1|list of highly cited [on Wikipedia] journals without articles]]). Specifically, we cover academic journals and their publishers, academic societies and their bulletins [internal publications], academic conferences and their proceedings, academic awards prizes and medals, and series of monographs. We also cover (to a lesser extent) academic libraries, archives, and databases. {{Box-footer|}}
{{Portal:Physics/box-header|Suggestions|Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals}} When using an academic journal as a source and/or if you are starting an article on a journal, you should do the following: * Check whether it is on the (discontinued) [https://web.archive.org/web/20170103170850/https://scholarlyoa.com/publishers/ Beall's List of Predatory Journals] (or its [https://beallslist.net/ mirror]) - if it's on the list, don't use it, please! {{Box-footer|}}
{{Portal:Physics/box-header|[[Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals/Article alerts|Article Alerts]]|Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals/Article alerts}} {{/Article alerts}} {{User:WolterBot/Cleanup listing subscription|hidden=1}} {{Box-footer|}}
{{User:WP 1.0 bot/Tables/Project/Academic Journal}}
{{Portal:Physics/box-header|New articles|Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals}} [[Category:Wikipedia new articles|Academic journals]] {{See also|Wikipedia:Version 1.0 Editorial Team/Academic Journal articles by quality log}} Please feel free to list your new articles on journals or journals-related topics here''' (newer articles at the top, please)'''. Any new articles that have an interesting or unusual fact in them should be suggested for the [[Template talk:Did you know|Did you know?]] box on the [[Main Page]]. Please remember to check new articles against [[Beall's List]]s (both publishers and standalone journals, as they are non-overlapping). {{columns-list|colwidth=30em| *2025-04-14: ''[[Women's Studies (journal)|Women's Studies]]'' *2024-12-29: ''[[G√©otechnique]]'' *2024-06-01: ''[[OpenAlex]]'' *2023-12-07: ''[[Journal of Dramatic Theory and Criticism]]'' *2023-01-21: ''[[Liver International]]'' }} {{Box-footer|}} {{Box-footer|}} {{Portal:Physics/box-header|Did you know...|Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals/Did you know}} {{anchor|Did you know...|DYK}} These are the 10 most recent ''Did you know...'' articles and their blurbs for the project. The full list of all entries is available [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals/Did you know|here]] and is automatically maintained by [[User:JL-Bot|JL-Bot]]. {{/Did you know}} {{Box-footer|}} {{Portal:Physics/box-header|Participants|Wikipedia:WikiProject Academic Journals}} Please feel free to add yourself here, and to indicate any areas of particular interest: * [[User:Geoscientific|Geoscientific]] ([[User talk:G.scaringi|talk]]) 04:08, 24 May 2018 (UTC), geosciences, natural hazards, engineering geology and geotechnical engineering * [[User:John Vandenberg|John Vandenberg]] 09:48, 19 February 2007 (UTC) * [[User:Tillander|Tillander]] 08:10, 4 August 2011 (UTC) humanities journals * [[User:Bduke|Bduke]] 10:26, 10 April 2007 (UTC) * [[User:3JSHMerryPippin|3JSHMerryPippin]] ([[User talk:3JSHMerryPippin|talk]]) 22:53, 28 January 2011 (UTC), sciences * '''[[User:DGG|DGG]]''' 02:06, 20 April 2007 (UTC) * [[User:Carcharoth|Carcharoth]] 13:50, 31 August 2007 (UTC) * [[User:ddstretch| DDStretch ]] [[User talk:ddstretch|(talk)]] 15:38, 31 August 2007 (UTC) * '''[[User:Simoes|Sim√µes]]''' ([[User talk:Guppyfinsoup|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Simoes|contribs]]) 16:46, 17 September 2007 (UTC) * [[User:Delirium|Delirium]] 16:54, 17 September 2007 (UTC) * [[User:Evolauxia|Evolauxia]] 21:16, 17 September 2007 (UTC) All, but particularly atmospheric, earth system, and physical sciences * [[User:David Eppstein|David Eppstein]] 17:46, 26 September 2007 (UTC). main_page_ai_sections.title: Introduction
main_page_ai_sections.content:
{{Short description|Wikipedia subject-area collaboration}}{{WikiProject status|active|parent=|portal=|type=|sc1=|sc2=}}
<!-- Documentation for the status template is at [[Template:WikiProject status]].
     You can add the associate portal, shortcuts, and more information to the banner.

     Adjust this section so that the link, wording, and (often) upper/lower casing of the topic are adjusted, the English-language variety is as intended (e.g. "organisation" or "organization"), and so on. The bulk of the wording should not be altered.
-->
{{TOC right}}
Welcome to '''WikiVault and GenAI Wikipedia'''! '''WikiVault''' is a GenAI-assisted Wikipedia editing tool that has been deployed on the Korean Wikipedia since May 2025.
It was developted by Korean Wikipedian Ted Yoo, one of the project's participants, with the support from the Korean WikiMedia Association. 
The tool currently provides two main functions:
* Translation ‚Äì translating English articles into Korean
* Article drafting ‚Äì generating initial article drafts from user prompts

More details about the tool's functionality can be found [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Korea/WikiVault|on this page]].

Since its deployment, there have been active community discussions within the Korean Wikipedia about the use of WikiVault - ranging from policy considerations to values and concerns around AI-assisted editing. 
Across many language editions of Wikipedia, communities are also exploring how to thoughtfully integrate GenAI tools into their workflows. 
The Korean experience with WikiVault can provide a valuable opportunity to learn from a real-world deployment and contribute data-driven, community-centered insights to these broader conversations.

main_page_ai_sections.title: Scope
main_page_ai_sections.content: We aim to explore the multi-dimensional impact of the WikiVault tool on the Korean Wikipedia (KoWiki), focusing on three key aspects: '''content''', '''editors''', and the '''community'''. ;Content * How does WikiVault affect the quality, depth, and sourcing of Wikipedia articles? * Has the introduction of WikiVault led to more translation-based activity, and correspondingly fewer original content additions? * Do pages created or edited through WikiVault show different topic or category distributions compared to other edits? ;Editors * Are edits assisted by WikiVault more likely to be reverted (e.g., tagged with mw-reverted or mw-rollback) than other edits? * Are new users who start editing through WikiVault more likely to continue editing over time? * How does WikiVault affect editors‚Äô motivations and perceived autonomy? * How do different editor groups ‚Äî newcomers, experienced users, patrollers ‚Äî experience or perceive WikiVault‚Äôs assistance? ;Community * How does the community respond to WikiVault edits in discussions, policies, and norms? * What values do Korean Wikipedia contributors see as most important in editing, and how do they think WikiVault aligns with or challenges those values? * How do editors perceive the quality and trustworthiness of WikiVault-assisted content? * Has participation in WikiVault-related discussions contributed to or hindered editors‚Äô sense of belonging within the Korean Wikipedia community? This project therefore combines data analysis, community observation, and qualitative inquiry to understand the evolving relationship between human editors, AI tools, and the shared norms of collaborative knowledge creation.

main_page_ai_sections.title: New articles
main_page_ai_sections.content:
Please feel free to list your new WikiVault: AI in Korean Wikipedia-related articles here (newer articles at the top, please). Any new articles that have an interesting or unusual fact in them, are at least over 1,500 characters, don't have any dispute templates on them, ''and cite their sources'', should be suggested for the [[Template talk:Did you know|Did you know?]] box on the Wikipedia [[Main Page]].
